N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2604.3 - Annual reports and audits

State Regulations
(a) Within
75 days after the expiration of each contract, the company shall submit the
following annual reports: (1)

An annual
financial report comparing the approved budget to actual accrued expenditures
on such forms as prescribed by the division. This report may be prepared by the
company's fiscal staff, and must be reviewed and signed by the executive
director and a member of the board of directors. (2)

An annual program report outlining the
accomplishments of the company in the completion of the neighborhood
preservation activities on such forms as prescribed by the division. This
report must be reviewed by the executive director and the chairman of the board
of directors. (b) Within
90 days after the end of each company's fiscal year, during which neighborhood
preservation funds have been received or expended, an annual audit shall be
submitted in accordance with the division's accounting manual. This audit must
be prepared by an independent certified public accountant. Notes
